Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: First, I need to look at the event log and find activities that appear multiple times within the same case. From the log, I see that Verify Documents, Call Customer, and Adjust Account appear multiple times in some cases. Let me list out the cases: - Case C001: - Initiate Request - Verify Documents (first time) - Call Customer (first time) - Submit Additional - Verify Documents (second time) - Approve Request - Case C002: - Initiate Request - Verify Documents (first time) - Call Customer (first time) - Adjust Account (first time) - Call Customer (second time) - Approve Request - Case C003: - Initiate Request - Verify Documents (first time) - Call Customer (first time) - Adjust Account (first time) - Verify Documents (second time) - Approve Request So, the recurring activities are: - Verify Documents - Call Customer - Adjust Account

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: In C001, Verify Documents appears twice, Call Customer appears once? No, in C001, Call Customer appears only once. Lets see: C001: Initiate, Verify, Call, Submit, Verify, Approve so Verify twice, Call once. C002: Initiate, Verify, Call, Adjust, Call, Approve so Verify once, Call twice. C003: Initiate, Verify, Call, Adjust, Verify, Approve so Verify twice, Call once. So in C002, Call Customer appears twice. In C001 and C003, Verify Documents appears twice. Therefore, for activities that recur within a case: Verify Documents in C001 and C003, and Call Customer in C002.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now, I need to interpret how their meaning changes based on context. Start with Verify Documents: - In C001, the first Verify Documents is about checking identity documents, and it leads to a call because verification is incomplete. The second Verify Documents is after the customer submits additional documents, so its a re-verification. - In C002, theres only one Verify Documents, but in C003, there are two: first verification, then after account adjustment, a re-verification. - So, Verify Documents can be initial verification or re-verification after additional information or adjustments. Similarly, Call Customer: - In C001, the first call is to request missing documents. In C002, the first call is to clarify account discrepancy, and the second call is a follow-up to confirm adjustments. In C003, the call is because the customer stepped out, so its to have them return. - So, Call Customer can be for different purposes: requesting missing information, clarifying issues, follow-up, or recalling customer.
